text.section: To qualify for appointment to act as a railroad police officer under this subtitle, an applicant shall be an individual who meets the requirements of this section.

section.section: The applicant shall be of good moral character.
The applicant may not have been convicted of a felony or misdemeanor involving moral turpitude.

text.section: The applicant shall be at least 21 years old.

The applicant shall:
be a full-time police officer employed by a railroad company on July 1, 1979; or
meet all the educational and training requirements required by the Police Training Commission.
